cd:double.name: goal
cd:double.description: The goal that the y-values of a run need to reach in order to be considered as successful.

cd:instance.name: criterion
cd:instance.description: How the y-values are compared to the goal.

cd:choice.description: The y-value must dip under the goalfor its corresponding run to be considered as successful.
The y-value must be less or equal compared to the goalfor its corresponding run to be considered as successful.
The y-value must exactly equal to the goal for its corresponding run to be considered as successful.
The y-value must reach above the goalfor its corresponding run to be considered as successful.
The y-value must be greater or equal compared to the goalfor its corresponding run to be considered as successful.
The y-value must not equal to the goal for its corresponding run to be considered as successful. (This would be quite an odd choice.)

cd:instance.name: aggregate
cd:instance.description: The ECDF is computed over each benchmark instance separately. Then, these separate functions must be aggregated over the instance groups (or all instances).
